caption:
The photograph prominently features a sturdy stone bridge arching over a body of water. The bridge, with an old-fashioned architectural design, is adorned with lamp posts and several flags fluttering in the breeze. The bridge spans across the frame with multiple arches visible, allowing glimpses of a faded landscape in the background. Hills and open sky can be seen in the distance behind the bridge.

In the foreground, a focus point is a grouping of three heavy, wooden pilings tied together with thick, coiled ropes. The wood's textures are highlighted, showing weathered surfaces and worn edges. The turquoise-green water surrounding these pilings adds a vibrant contrast while small waves lap gently against the wood. The image captures the tranquil interaction between human-made structures and natural elements, under what appears to be cloudy or overcast lighting conditions.
title: London Bridge--brought from London to Lake Havasu City in 1971
